column4: 4aFka - what do you mean? The synaptic package manager is full of IDEs and compiler engines. Are you after them, or tutorials on how to program?
i want to write an c++ program in ubuntu.. what i need?
'4aFkA' Search for Anjuta in synaptic, it's an IDE
'$aFkA' - Also, g++ if it's not installed
- you don't even get any sort of menu at all? Straight away, blank?
